posts.title: Getting Started with React Router
posts.content:
React Router lets you build multi-page experiences in a single-page app.

In this post, we cover installing react-router-dom, creating routes, and linking between pages.

Finally, we'll add a dynamic route like /post/:slug and show a not-found state.
posts.excerpt: Learn how to set up React Router, create routes, and build a basic SPA navigation.
posts.author: Ayesha Khan

posts.title: Building a Simple Blog with JSON Server
posts.content:
JSON Server gives you a quick REST API from a JSON file.

We'll create db.json, run json-server on port 3001, and connect from React using fetch.

You'll learn basic endpoints: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE.
posts.excerpt: Use JSON Server as a mock backend and build full CRUD endpoints quickly.
posts.author: Bilal Ahmed

posts.title: Writing Better CSS for Clean Layouts
posts.content:
Good CSS starts with spacing, typography, and a consistent layout system.

We'll build a responsive grid for blog cards and a readable post detail page.

Also: simple utility classes for muted text, badges, and buttons.
posts.excerpt: A practical CSS checklist for spacing, typography, and responsive layout.
posts.author: Sana Riaz

posts.title: Slugify Titles the Right Way
posts.content:
A slug is a URL-friendly version of a title.

We'll remove special characters, lowercase everything, and replace spaces with hyphens.

Then we’ll enforce uniqueness on the admin side with a warning.
posts.excerpt: Generate clean, URL-friendly slugs and avoid duplicates in your UI.
posts.author: Ayesha Khan

posts.title: Admin CRUD UX: Forms, Validation, and Feedback
posts.content:
A usable admin panel needs helpful feedback.

We'll add required validation for title/content/author/category, disable submit while saving, and confirm deletes.

We’ll also handle server-down errors with friendly messaging.
posts.excerpt: Make admin CRUD practical: validation, loading states, and delete confirmations.
posts.author: Bilal Ahmed

posts.title: Suggestion Algorithms for Related Posts
posts.content:
Related posts keep users engaged.

We'll prefer posts from the same category, then add tag overlap scoring.

If not enough matches exist, we fill the remainder with the latest posts.
posts.excerpt: Implement a simple related-posts system using category + tag overlap scoring.
posts.author: Sana Riaz
